data.enText: if sth is scarce , there is not enough of it and it is only available in small quantities

data.chText: 事故的详细情况了解不多。
data.enText: Details of the accident are scarce.
to leave somewhere and stay away for a time in order to avoid an unpleasant situation
to leave somewhere and stay away for a time in order to avoid an unpleasant situation

tr: deficient in quantity or number compared with the demand
example: fresh vegetables were scarce during the drought

tr: only a very short time before
example: they could barely hear the speaker
had scarcely rung the bell when the door flew open
would have scarce arrived before she would have found some excuse to leave"- W.B.Yeat

value.def: If something is scarce, there is not enough of it.

example.tran: 食物供不应求，而且价格昂贵。

value.tran: 缺乏的;不足的;供不应求的

value.def: If you make yourself scarce, you quickly leave the place you are in, usually in order to avoid a difficult or embarrassing situation.

example.ex: It probably would be a good idea if you made yourself scarce.

value.tran: (通常为避开难事或僵局)躲开，溜走，回避

trans: (通常为避开难事或僵局)躲开，溜走，回避
